message: does anyone else notice this?
i'm on chrome beta on windows and i can feel the sluggishness specially when scrolling
I'm using Chrome on a MacBook Pro and it's fast.
I haven't really noticed any issues with Chrome on Windows 7. It's been the same as with Firefox 4.
@lzm Fast for me on Firefox on OS X
It's even fast on my old 1GHz PPC
It's fast even on my 900mhz/1gb ram netbook
the animated GIF thread on the Pownce group is slow unless you got a fast internet connection.... *sigh* *duh* *no doya* ...but it's still a problem...
@georgalis, GIF animations are slow as hell in WebKit browsers…
Doesn't seem slow for me generally, but changing topics in a group is taking a day and a half for some reason
convore, in general, seems to be having performance problems lately. maybe the re-work Leah is working on will address these and other issues??
How many servers is Convore running on?  It feels like only one, a second server would speed things up significantly.

Yeah it's gotten really slow in the last couple weeks, requests take forever to complete. @Leah is reworking the backend by the end of the summer, so stick around until then to see what progress she's made. The re-architecting is probably why less resources are being poured into making it glide.

yeah, sorry everyone... I've been both working on new technology that should make the new version speedier and I've been hacking the current convore so that it's not suuuuper slow (but it's still pretty slow)

@leah out of curiosity.. why isn't convore hiring new people as two of your co-founder went away... it would speed up the overall process.. I can probably imagine the pain that you two now are dealing with
i agree
@equinox I'm glad at least Leah is hanging in. Hopefully an investor will come along soon so convore can get back on track.
Noticing today that when I submit a reply, it takes a while to upload, also deleting doesn't immediately hide the message after the confirmation.

They need more servers and maybe a server for the API since that is extremely slow and timesout ALOT, @craigshipp as of now no investor will invest, if they do want a invest they will want a huge piece like 20%-40%(two extremes) of the convore pie and for beta software no wants to give that much so yea probably need to get alot more features before even going into those numbers
yea, the API is also slow... and RTO's
sorry about the slowness! I'm working on it. Thanks for the support too!

@italiano40 (IMO)  convore has a huge upside but I'm sure it will take some cash to work out the kinks. Unlike facebook and twitter this platform could be a valuable tool for businesses and could be profitable by serving up targeted ads in the free version and no ads in a paid version. This could be very efficient and powerful.
May help if people give a general idea how what they mean by "slow".  I'm on a 13" (2011) MacBook Pro using Google Chrome and I'm not seeing any issues of what I would consider slow.

@Caballeraz it loads so slowwwwwwwwww and working with the api kinda sucks since the speeds are so long, 3m for an api call, all they need is one more two more servers to handle the amount of people accessing it
Twice yesterday and once today, convore's cat visited me on my browser, something in the backend seem to be timing out.
Convore's cat! :) Well, I still dig the concept of Convore. Best of luck with the revised version.
Convore's cat! :) Well, I still dig the concept of Convore. Best of luck with the revised version.
Convore's cat! :) Well, I still dig the concept of Convore. Best of luck with the revised version.
@bat we all hope but yea maybe they need http://i.imgur.com/v1bms.jpg to be a couple servers LOL
It seems I might be coming here every week in 2012 hoping that Convore's finally been given some performance love.
That's how much I like convore. Love the favorites.
Seeing it verry slow as well....

Not only slow for changing topics and sometime it takes a while for a chat message to appear after clicking the 'submit' button...the more frustrating issue is that messages randomly gone missing, happened quite frequently lately....e.g. you type a message, hit submit button, then the message gets displayed for a few seconds then if you refresh the page or a subsequent chat message comes in and yours just disappeared all of sudden. More than a dozen of members who I chat with and also including myself have experienced this issue lately.

@leah, if we are happy to pay what Hipchat(another live chat website) charges - $1 per member, per month for my group's 140+ members, would it be possible to move my group to a faster convore server so we wont experience problems like missing messages and slow response etc?  Apart from that, convore is a great platform, simply love it! Keep up the good work, thank you.
@lzm sure do. Is there any chance it can be speeded up?
We've moved our community chat to hipchat, because convore was too slow to use :( However to be honest I far prefer convore, so if the speed problem could be sorted we'd come back.
Convore has a nice interface and is a cool idea, however it is so slow it's barely usable.
it's been like this for quite a long time now.. even if it was fixed, will convore's reputation recover?
I love convore! The performance of the site is killing the iPhone app, please add some more webscale!
I have the same problem it keeps timing out on my iPhone. I wonder what future Convore has now that Googgle+ is doing so well
^also facebook chat is now essentially convore inside facebook. convore had better functionality, reliability and speed at the beginning, but now fb-chat is on par or winning in every aspect
Well, came here to make sure it wasn't just me. For me it's honestly totally useless at this point. Signing off...
(err. to be clear, the service is awesome.. performance is what I can't tolerate right now. Pageloads sometimes up to a minute or so)
I'm finding it a little slow as well.
For the last couple of weeks this has been so slow We are also thinking of moving out.
Its unbearable, we're looking at other prospects - http://dialog.gs looks great, but won't be ready till October. Hopefully it won't be as disappointing as convore is
this is a real shame as there really is no other service as powerful as convore. I hope Leah can find some backers and get this service back on track.
Some people in my group can’t even log in during the mornings (east coast).
Things seem a little better this morning.  I was hoping that the big outage yesterday had to do with an upgrade.
Yes, it now seems much more tolerable. Not snappy, but I'm willing to wait a couple seconds. Minutes is the issue.
fast for me.

I would hope to see an announcement from @Leah about the site and where it's going. I know previously she said she was working on a rewrite of the back end this summer... and well, the summer's over so let's hear how it went :)
@Aranjedeath well the site was down, she is the last co-founder left in the company, so i guess not too well i have a feeling it will either be sold, kinda like another pownce js
If Convore should close or be sold, does anyone know an alternative to Convore, which offers some of the same features?
the site seems to be a lot faster.
I'm still having the problem of slow loading, frequent error messages.... and the worst part is... my posting is lost almost every other time.  (Located in Taiwan, Asia)

@taikuchen So am I, for slow loading, frequent error messages and slow processing of my posting. I love Convore for the wonderful  UI and functions such as star systems. I don't wanna move to another service, Chatwork. So please make it just faster. (from Sapporo, Japan)
It seems the slowness has been at least partially corrected. Now I can navigate and post faster.
UR MOMS VERY SLOW
Still slow. I don't think there has been any significant improvement. Convore has been more or less broken and seemingly abandoned by its developers for half a year now.

At this point it's suffering from a lack of developer communication. If @Leah said `oh yeah, I'm gonna put up a new codebase that'll be all fast at the end of the month, sorry guys` we'd have a date, or something to aim for. But right now we have something from this spring that says `I'm working on a new backend this summer` and we've seen or heard nothing more about it.
it's faster but fewer people are in the rooms I'm interested in :(
after a few hours of downtime, it seems faster now.. I hope this holds and isn't just because there are so few people online now
How is the UI running these days? We moved to Hipchat a few months ago and whilst it runs very smoothly, free will always beat paid!
Very very very slow here. US East coast.
